TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RepeatInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the information used to render a list control that repeats a list of items. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> class encapsulates the information used to render a list control that repeats a list of items, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList>. It is primarily used by control developers.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> class using default values.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |OuterTableImplied|`false`| |RepeatColumns|`0`| |RepeatDirection|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection.Vertical>| |RepeatLayout|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property if the control is rendered as a .
Docs.value: A string that specifies the caption.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the caption, if the is rendered as a .
Docs.value: A value for the rendered table. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.CaptionAlign%2A> property of the rendered <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.

Docs.exception: The selected value is not one of the values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table.
Docs.value: if the items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.OuterTableImplied%2A> property to specify whether items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RenderRepeater (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer, System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser user, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style controlStyle, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl baseControl);

.method public hidebysig instance void RenderRepeater(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser user, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style controlStyle, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl baseControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The that represents the output stream used to render HTML content on the client.
An implemented object that represents the control to render.
A that represents the style in which to display the items.
The control from which to copy base attributes.
Docs.summary: Renders a list control that repeats a list of items, using the specified information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method to render a list control that repeats a list of items, using the specified information.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns to render.
Docs.value: The number of columns to render.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property to specify the number of columns to render in the control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the items are displayed vertically or horizontally.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatDirection%2A> property to specify the direction that the items are rendered.
> [!NOTE] > The number of columns displayed is always determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property.
If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical`, the items in the list are displayed in columns loaded top to bottom, then left to right, until all items are rendered. For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items are displayed in three columns, as in the following table.
|||| |-|-|-| |1|4|7| |2|5|8| |3|6|9|
If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal`, the items in the list are displayed in rows loaded left to right, then top to bottom, until all items are rendered. For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items are displayed in rows of three items each, as in the following table.
|||| |-|-|-| |1|2|3| |4|5|6| |7|8|9|

Docs.exception: The specified direction is not one of the enumeration values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying whether items are displayed in a table.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatLayout%2A> property to specify whether the items are displayed in a table. If this property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, the items in the list are displayed in a table. If this property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Flow>, the items in the list are displayed without a table structure.

Docs.exception: The specified layout is not one of the enumeration values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate whether to add a attribute when the control is rendered as a .
Docs.value: if a "scope" attribute is to be added, otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `true` and the control is rendered as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>, a "scope" attribute with value "col" is added and a table header cell (\<th>) is rendered instead of a table cell (\<td>) for the header cells when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> is rendered. This attribute can be used by screen readers.
